intro: Microcos dulitensis, commonly known as the Madagascar hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Microcos dulitensis is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid forest environments.
